A <video> should not have a layer until playback begins.
This test can not be run manually, it requires testRunner.layerTreeAsText.

Case: No src, no poster
{
  "name": "Content Root Layer",
  "bounds": [800, 600],
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "bounds": [800, 600],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true
    }
  ]
}


Case: Displaying poster
{
  "name": "Content Root Layer",
  "bounds": [785, 617],
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "bounds": [785, 617],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true
    }
  ]
}


Case: Displaying movie
{
  "name": "Content Root Layer",
  "bounds": [785, 842],
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "bounds": [785, 842],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true,
      "children": [
        {
          "name": "LayoutVideo VIDEO",
          "position": [8, 8],
          "bounds": [352, 288]
        },
        {
          "name": "Squashing Containment Layer",
          "shouldFlattenTransform": false,
          "children": [
            {
              "name": "LayoutFlexibleBox (relative positioned) DIV",
              "position": [8, 8],
              "bounds": [352, 288],
              "drawsContent": true
            },
            {
              "name": "Squashing Layer (first squashed layer: LayoutFlexibleBox (relative positioned) DIV)",
              "position": [8, 8],
              "bounds": [352, 246],
              "drawsContent": true
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
